sourceOfFunds.purpose: The project in Pandhurna block – ‘Empowerment and inclusion of PWDs’ commenced in 2015 and completed its 1st phase in 2016. The second phase will be for 2016 – 2018. It is being implemented in 25 villages of the block. The overall impact visualized is that people in the community especially those with disability are considered as equal members of the community and have space and opportunities to realize their potentials.
The project in Sausar block – ‘Empowerment and inclusion of PWDs’ commenced in 2007 and completed its phase in 2015.

22 village level DPOs (disabled people’s organization) have come together on one platform and merged as ‘Chetana’ block level DPO. It is formally registered and officiated by a President, Vice-President and Secretary. The BDPO is a cross-disability one and enables PWDs to act, think, combat and advocate as a group towards their rights and entitlements.

The CMHP (community mental health program) on one part and CAMP (community action on mental health program) on the other focuses on four basic components: Awareness, Capacity building of health functionaries, Rehabilitation and Advocacy.

‘Chetana Disabled Persons Organization’ is a block level registered and structured cross-disability advocacy organization which works to change policies and ensure equal rights and equal opportunities for PWDs. The Sausar block based DPO consists of 44 members of which 11 members are part of the management committee.

GASVS began partnering with CBR Forum-Bangalore in 2007. Four phases of ‘Community based rehabilitation’ [CBR] of persons with disabilities [PWDs] have been completed including two phases of phasing out. In these phases from 2007 – 2017, PWDs have been made aware of their own roles and responsibilities and are equipped to exercise their rights and play a proactive role in addressing the issues affecting their lives and that of the community.

The project in Pandhurna block – ‘Empowerment and inclusion of PWDs’ commenced in 2015 and completed its 1st phase in 2016. The second phase will be for 2016 – 2018. It is being implemented in 25 villages of the block. The overall impact visualized is that people in the community especially those with disability are considered as equal members of the community and have space and opportunities to realize their potentials.

The District Disability Rehabilitation Center [DDRC] is a scheme of the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. It basically seeks to provide PWDs at the grassroots level through creation of the infrastructure and capacity building for awareness generation, rehabilitation, training and guiding of village level functionaries.

The District Disability Rehabilitation Center [DDRC] is a scheme of the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. It basically seeks to provide PWDs at the grassroots level through the creation of the infrastructure and capacity building for awareness generation, rehabilitation, training, and guiding of village-level functionaries.

Since 2019, this initiative is supported by Paul Hamlyn Foundation (UK), covering 80 villages of Sausar block, including the ‘Hanuman’ temple complex. The goal of the project is to provide a continuum of care and support to PwMI (persons with mental illness) through collaborative community care approaches. The project area is made up of a high tribal and SC population. Korku; Gond; Pardhan; Bharia are the major tribal communities.

GASVS started to implement this project in 2015. The CBR model has been recognized as an appropriate one of service delivery to provide effective rehabilitation and therapy services to rural and remote indigenous communities. It refers to the delivery of basic services necessary to improve the participation and functioning in daily activity. CBR is a plan of action in community development for equalization of the opportunities, social integration of all PwDs and rehabilitation.

The BDPO (block-level disabled persons organization) is called ‘Chetna Viklang Sangathan – Sausar’. It is made up of 22 VDPOs (village disabled persons organization) and is represented by 417 PwDs. The Governing body has 11 members of which 06 are male and 05 are female. The members of the BDPO sensitize the community with regard to RPwD Act – 2016 and Mental health act – 2017. The BDPO members support the VDPO members and make them function effectively.

The DDRC (district disability rehabilitation center) was established on the 1st of January 2017 to provide therapeutic, preventive, supportive and rehabilitative services to PwDs (persons with disabilities) in Sukma district of the State of Chhatisgarh. The DDRC is set up under the plan scheme SIPDA – Act 1995. The main aim is to create infrastructure facilities and capacity building at the district level for awareness generation and rehabilitation of PwD

sourceOfFunds.purpose: CMHP includes creating access to mental health interventions and developing sustainable measures for empowering the community on mental health. The major aim of this program is to facilitate mental health interventions from the government health care facilities within Pandhurna block of Chhindwara district along with home-based psycho-education by trained CHWs (community health workers). To sustain these efforts partnership and capacity building of government health delivery systems.

The pandemic caused by Covid – 19 and the severity of its impact is most intense among the people who are marginalized and vulnerable such as PwMI/PwDs and the elderly poor. They are also most likely to fall into further poverty and ill-health, if they are not able to access the provisions required for survival at the right time. Through this program, we have distributed Ration Kits to our beneficiaries like the elderly, daily earners, old age, farmers, and other needy peoples.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have complete twenty five years of service in the area of sustainable development and we have rich experience of working with national and international norms at present we are trying to foster all our activities towards achieving the sustainable development goals these long years of experience have built organization skill capacity and understanding the needs of development aspects

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: KVIC Zila Panchayat Hans Foundation ACC Keymoure Dept. of Horticulture DFID CA Caritas Hans Culture Center Rio Tinto Exploration Pvt Ltd
sourceOfFunds.purpose: The organisation has been involved in entrepreneurship development, livelihood promotion in different villages through skill building of the communities. We have been able to undertake watershed development and provide water for domestic consumption, irrigation fostering livelihood security in drought hit areas. Training and capacity building of Panchayat Raj Representatives. BRGF , watershed planning have been undertaken. we have also worked on the concept of GIS, Biogas etc

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Rural India Supporting Trust KVIC ZilaPanchayat Riotinto
sourceOfFunds.purpose: The organisation has been actively promoting Bio Gas, Toilets under Total Sanitation Programme, Promotion of kitchen garden to ensure good supply of vegetables and improve the health of the people, dairy promotion through distribution of buffaloes and dairy management training have been given to the women in the project area. Skill development through promotion of craft and furniture using local resources like lantana Sesal and bamboo have helped the community to earn their livelihood.

The purpose of our programs have been to raise the living standard of the people in the project area. We have tried to raise the socio economic standard of the people of the area. The poor and the marginalized community have been always at the focal point of our intervention.

We have been working in the area of watershed development and implementation of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Program We have also take Need Based Assessment study for community development and have also prepared the plans for the same

ngoList.title: Guru Gobind Singh Educational Society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Over a period of time, Guru Gobind Singh Educational Society has founded eight schools including English & Hindi medium Schools and today it has strength of around 8,500 students. It was amongst the aims of society to provide education to worthy, irrespective of their caste & creed. Because of this, the schools were established at remote corners of city also, with all amenities. Till date around 2.5 lakh students have been imparted education by various enterprises of society. Society has around 1,300 employees as on date, & some are in employ, since formation of society. Non teaching staff is being given benefit of Provident Fund. Leave rules & other advantages are applicable to staff members. After consolidation of schools, Guru Gobind Singh Educational Society addressed the burning need of providing college education to girls of Jabalpur and nearby areas. This became genesis of an all girlâ€™s college, Mata Gujri Mahilla Mahavidyalaya in 1994. Over the period of time, number of discipline and number of students kept on increasing and today, Mata Gujri Mahilla Mahavidyalaya is offering courses in graduate and post graduate disciplines. Mata Gujri Mahilla Mahavidyalaya has recognized IGNOU and PTU centre. , Mata Gujri Mahilla Mahavidyalaya is accredited â€˜Aâ€™ by NAAC of UGC. Mata Gujri Mahilla Mahavidyalaya also has a hostel for more than 600 girls. As on date, around 5,500 girl students are shaping their future in Mata Gujri Mahilla Mahavidyalaya & getting admission in college is being considered as symbol of Intellect. In technical education started with introduction of Guru Ramdas Khalsa Institute of Science & Technology (BE) in 1997. Guru Ramdas Khalsa Institute of Science & Technology (BE) was first private engineering college of Jabalpur, Mahakaushal and Vindyachal region. Keeping in view the vision, Guru Gobind Singh Educational Society acquired 156 acres of land in village Kukrikheda, Barela. The GRKIST group of institutions campus is situated only 16 Km from heart of city by road & only 10 km from Dumna Airport. In year 1999, Guru Gobind Singh Educational Society established Guru Ramdas Khalsa Institute of Science & Technology (MCA), which was again the first private college not only in Jabalpur, but in Mahakaushal, Vidyanchal and Bundelkhand region. In year 2002, society introduced Guru Ramdas Khalsa Institute of Science & Technology (Pharmacy) which was again the first private pharmacy college in Jabalpur as well as Mahakaushal, Vindhyanchal and Bundelkhand region.
